sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"肉"之意。
means: meat ： 是肉类的总称，指食用的肉，但不包括鱼类的肉。
flesh ： 主要指人体或动物身上的肌肉组织，是从生理角度着眼的。也指动物的肉食。

word_mean: 肉：动物的柔软肌肉组织

sentence.Network_en: I was heading on a secret mission that made my flesh crawl.
sentence.Network_cn: 我正要执行一项让我心惊肉跳的秘密任务。

sentence.Network_en: I grab George'sarm and dig my nails into his flesh.
sentence.Network_cn: 我抓住乔治的胳膊，指甲抠进了他的肉里。

sentence.Network_en: There may even be some wire or nylon biting into the flesh.
sentence.Network_cn: 甚至可能有一些金属丝或者尼龙线勒到肉里。

phrase.cizu_name: go the way of all flesh

jx.jx_en_mean: die or come to an end

lj.lj_ly: the film has gone the way of all flesh after being slated by the critics.
lj.lj_ls: 这部电影遭到批评家们的斥责后，从此悄无声息。

jx.jx_en_mean: cause someone to feel fear, horror, or disgust
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使感到害怕（或恐惧，厌恶）

lj.lj_ly: his story will make your flesh creep.
lj.lj_ls: 他的故事会令你毛骨悚然。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to refer to the spiritual and physical union of two people in a relationship, especially marriage
jx.jx_cn_mean: 一体（指两人精神和肉体结合关系，尤指婚姻）

lj.lj_ly: my body is his, his is mine: one flesh.
lj.lj_ls: 我的身体是他的，他的身体是我的，我俩成为一体。

phrase.cizu_name: put flesh on (the bones of) something

jx.jx_en_mean: add more details to something which only exists in a draft or outline form

lj.lj_ly: he has yet to put flesh on his ‘big idea’.
lj.lj_ls: 他的“伟大构思”还有待他充实具体内容。

jx.jx_en_mean: (archaic or humorous)sins related to physical indulgence, especially sexual gratification

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English flāsc, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vlees and German Fleisch

entry.def: Flesh is the soft part of a person's or animal's body between the bones and the skin.

example.ex: ...the pale pink flesh of trout and salmon.
example.tran: 淡粉色的鳟鱼和鲑鱼肉

entry.def: You can use flesh to refer to human skin and the human body, especially when you are considering it in a sexual way.
The flesh of a fruit or vegetable is the soft inside part of it.

example.ex: Cut the flesh from the olives and discard the stones.
example.tran: 把橄榄的果肉切下来，然后去除果核。

entry.def: You use flesh and blood to emphasize that someone has human feelings or weaknesses, often when contrasting them with machines.

example.ex: I'm only flesh and blood, like anyone else.
example.tran: 我只是个凡人，和其他人一样。

example.ex: ...skills of a precision unmatched by any flesh and blood worker.
example.tran: 世上任何工人都无法达到的精准技巧

entry.def: If you say that someone is your own flesh and blood, you are emphasizing that they are a member of your family.

example.ex: The kid, after all, was his own flesh and blood. He deserved a second chance.
example.tran: 毕竟这个孩子是他的亲骨肉，应该给他第二次机会。

entry.tran: 使人反感;使毛骨悚然;使心惊肉跳
entry.def: If something makes your flesh creep or makes your flesh crawl, it makes you feel disgusted, shocked or frightened.

example.ex: It makes my flesh creep to think of it...
example.tran: 想到它就会让我毛骨悚然。

example.ex: I was heading on a secret mission that made my flesh crawl.
example.tran: 我正要执行一项让我心惊肉跳的秘密任务。

entry.def: If you meet or see someone in the flesh, you actually meet or see them, rather than, for example, seeing them in a film or on television.

example.ex: Charles' appeal is best observed in the flesh...
example.tran: 见到查尔斯本人才最能感受到他的魅力。

example.ex: The first thing viewers usually say when they see me in the flesh is 'You're smaller than you look on TV.'
example.tran: 观众见到我本人通常说的第一句话就是“你比电视上看上去要矮小一些。”

entry.def: If you put flesh on something, you add details and more information to it.

example.ex: This is an attempt to put flesh on what has been a very bare skeleton plan up to now.
example.tran: 这是一次试图使至今还只是框架的计划充实起来的尝试。

entry.def: If you flesh out something such as a story or plan, you add details and more information to it.

example.ex: He talked with him for an hour and a half, fleshing out the details of his original five-minute account...
example.tran: 他和他谈了一个半小时，将自己原来5 分钟的陈述完全展开了。

example.ex: He has since fleshed out his story.
example.tran: 他从此使自己的故事更加丰满。

means.word_mean: 1. the soft tissue of the body of a vertebrate: mainly muscle tissue and fat
2. alternative names for the body of a human being;

sentences.sentence: "the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak"

means.word_mean: 3. a soft moist part of a fruit

sentences.en: A fat man has much more flesh than a thin man.
The flesh of the peach was sweet and juicy.
His life was devoted to the pleasure of the flesh.
sentences.cn: 他一生贪图肉体上的舒适享受。

jushi.english: The spirit is willing but the flesh is weak.
His life was devoted to the pleasure of the flesh.
jushi.chinese: 他一生贪图肉体上的舒适享受。

jushi.english: A fat man has much more flesh than a thin man.
